contentrichtext.text: {{Orphan|date=February 2009}} The '''Koshibito''' (in [[Japanese language|Japanese]], variously: 高志人, 古志人 or 越人, all pronounced identically) were a people of ancient [[Japan]],<ref>{{cite book | title=Transactions of the Asiatic Society of Japan | year=1965 | volume=37 | page=261 }}</ref> believed to have lived on the southern portion of the shore of the [[Sea of Japan]]<ref>Frédéric, Louis. ''Japan encyclopedia''. Belknap Press, 2005. 563. Print.</ref> in the ancient province of [[Koshi Province|Koshi]]. They are believed to have spoken a [[Tungusic language]]<ref>[http://masakawai.suppa.jp/encartaAA/bunka/emisi/emisi.html 「蝦夷」と「アテルイ」]</ref> and come from [[Manchuria]] or the [[Korean Peninsula]].<ref>{{cite book | title=Mélanges japonais | editor=Sansaisha | publisher=Harvard U | year=1907 | pages=158–61 }}</ref><ref>Frédéric, Louis. ''Le japon: dictionnaire et civilisation''. Robert Laffont, 1996. Print.</ref> ==References== <references /> [[Category:Tribes of ancient Japan]] {{Asia-ethno-group-stub}} {{japan-hist-stub}}
